alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN AND SOUTHERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ripley, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Decatur, Russellville, Concord, Redoak, Trinity, Bradysville, State Route 348 at State Route 125, Ribolt, Bentonville and Herron Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
